summary: This document is a Quitclaim Deed and related affidavits transferring ownership of Little St. James Island from L.S.J., LLC to Nautilus, Inc. The deed, signed by Jeffrey E. Epstein, states the transfer is for nominal consideration ($10) and asserts a tax exemption as both entities are beneficially owned by Epstein. The document includes notarizations and a tax clearance letter.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.role: Sole Member of L.S.J., LLC; President and sole beneficial owner of Nautilus, Inc.
persons.context: He is the grantor executing the deed as the sole member of L.S.J., LLC, transferring the property to Nautilus, Inc., which he also solely owns and controls. He signs the deed and an affidavit claiming a tax exemption.

persons.name: D. Courtney Reese
persons.context: Listed as the Recorder of Deeds for St. Thomas/St. John on the official record stamps and document headers.

persons.name: Erika A. Kellerhals
persons.context: Notarizes the execution of the deed by Jeffrey Epstein and the witness attestations on December 23, 2011.

persons.name: Valencia Jackson
persons.context: Signs the Real Property Tax Clearance Letter certifying no outstanding tax obligations for the property as of December 27, 2011.

connections.description: Epstein is identified as the sole member of L.S.J., LLC, the grantor entity transferring the property.
Epstein is identified as the President and sole beneficial owner of Nautilus, Inc., the grantee entity receiving the property.
L.S.J., LLC conveys the Little St. James Island property to Nautilus, Inc. via this quitclaim deed, described as a conveyance between subsidiary entities both owned by Epstein.

events.title: Execution of Quitclaim Deed for Little St. James Island
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein, as sole member of L.S.J., LLC, executes a quitclaim deed transferring the Little St. James Island property to Nautilus, Inc. for a stated consideration of $10.00.

events.title: Affidavit for Tax Exemption
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein signs an affidavit asserting that the property transfer between L.S.J., LLC and Nautilus, Inc. is exempt from stamp taxes because it is a conveyance for no consideration between entities he beneficially owns.

events.title: Original Warranty Deed to L.S.J., LLC
events.description: A Warranty Deed dated April 27, 1998, and recorded May 15, 1998, originally conveyed the Little St. James Island property to L.S.J., LLC (the grantor in the 2011 deed).

locations: Little St. James Island, 6B Red Hook Quarter, St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands
6100 Red Hook Quarter, Suite B 3, St. Thomas, VI 00802 (address of L.S.J., LLC)
9100 Havensight, Port of Sale, Ste 15-16, St. Thomas, VI 00802 (address of Nautilus, Inc.)
Office of the Recorder of Deeds for St. Thomas and St. John, U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: On December 23, 2011, Jeffrey Epstein transferred ownership of Little St. James Island from L.S.J., LLC to Nautilus, Inc. via a quitclaim deed for a nominal $10.
Epstein was the sole member/owner of both the grantor (L.S.J., LLC) and grantee (Nautilus, Inc.) entities, making the transfer an intra-company transaction.
Epstein filed an affidavit claiming a stamp tax exemption for the transfer, asserting it was a conveyance for no consideration between his wholly-owned subsidiaries.
The property consists of Parcels A, B & C on Little St. James Island, totaling approximately 71.5 acres (36.7, 23, and 11.8 acres respectively).
A tax clearance letter dated December 27, 2011, certified no outstanding real property tax obligations for the parcel under L.S.J., LLC's ownership at the time of transfer.
